question: 零す
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>zero</kanji>, but the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to spill something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to drop something</vocabulary>. Think of it this way, if you spill something, eventually it will reach <kanji>zero</kanji>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Imagine a barrel of corn <reading>cob</reading>s, spilling and dropping out corn cobs, until they reach zero.
